chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin Daniel Laprise was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).
  • Possession of Controlled Substance, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.

May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.
No firearms.
Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.

Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  All prescriptions shall be approved by agent.
No contact with C.T. or any member of his family.
No contact with any victim in this case.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare + any other counseling as recommended by agent.

11:20 am
Defendant Justin Daniel Laprise in court with attorney Brad Hansen.  Defendant Justin Daniel Laprise in custody.  Allen R. Brey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Copy of restitution summary
Atty Hansen and def stipulate to restitution of $1649.99
Copy of victim info
DA spks on PSI
Atty Hansen spks on PSI
DA spks on sentencing
Atty Hansen spks on sentencing
Defendant addresses Court
Court imposes:  Ct 1 - 4 years; 2 yrs initial confinement, 2 yrs extended supervision.  Credit for 59 days.  Def is eligible for CIP and SAP.   
May not vote or serve on a jury until civil rights are restored.  No firearms.  Provide DNA sample & pay surcharge.  
Restitution $1,649.99 - payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
Costs & fees -  payable out of 25% of inmate funds while incarcerated, balance as a condition of community supervision.
No contact with C.T. or any member of his family.
No contact with any victim in this case.
Absolute sobriety to include no purchase, possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances unless prescribed by a physician and then only according to physician's orders.  All prescriptions shall be approved by agent.
Defendant is not to be in the company of any person who is using, purchasing or possessing illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
Obtain or maintain full time employment or part time employment if enrolled in school.
AODA assessment followed by treatment and aftercare + any other counseling as recommended by agent.
Count 2  - 30 days jail concurrent to count 1.
Costs remitted.
